documents.document: "Clear your mind of cant." - Dr. Samuel Johnson
"Nothing happens unless first a dream." - Carl Sandburg
"If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal. Not to people or things." - Albert Einstein
"I praise loudly, I blame softly." - Catherine the Great
"A room without books is like a body without a soul." - Marcus Tullius Cicero
"To want to forget something is to think of it. - French Proverb
Confucius said, "The only people who cannot change are the most wise and the most stupid."
Ralph Waldo Emerson wrote of cheerfulness, "the more it is spent, the more of it remains."
"Don't be afraid to ask directions from someone who has been, where you want to go."
"A man has honor if he holds himself to an ideal of conduct though it is inconvenient, unprofitable or dangerous to do so." - Walter Lip ...
"Anger is never without reason, but seldom with a good one." - Benjamin Franklin"
"The only limits are, as always, those of vision." - James Broughton
"The man who does not work for the love of work but only for money is not likely to make money nor find much fun in life." - Charles Schwab
"Money is like sea-water: The more we drink the thirstier we become; and the same is true of fame." - Schopenhauer
"Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely." - Lord Acton
"Time is a file that wears and makes no noise." - English proverb
"Many of us spend half our time wishing for things we could have if we didn't spend half our time wishing." - Alexander Woollcott
"We know not where our dreams will take us, but we can probably see quite clearly where we'll go without them." - Marilyn Grey
"Go confidently in the direction of your dreams; live the life you've imagined." - Thoreau
"Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length." - Robert Frost
"To show a child what once delighted you, to find the child's delight added to your own, this is happiness." - J. B. Priestley
"Strangely enough, this is the past that somebody in the future is longing to go back to." - Ashleigh brilliant
"Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content what you have." - Doris Mortman
"Do not believe that it is very much of an advance to do the unnecessary three times as fast." - Peter Drucker
"Children begin by loving their parents. After a time they judge them. Rarely, if ever, do they forgive them." - Oscar Wilde
"Before borrowing money from a friend, decide which you need most." - American Proverb
"Every exit is an entry somewhere." - Tom Stoppard
"They are able because they think they are able." - Virgil
"Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there." - Will Rogers
"Reality provides us with facts so romantic that imagination itself could add nothing to them" - Jules Verne
"Everything has its beauty but not everyone sees it." - Confucius
"Every sentence that I utter must be understood not as an affirmation, but as a question." - Niels Bohr
"Life being what it is, one dreams of revenge." - Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec
"The longer the excuse, the less likely it's the truth." - Robert Half (via @iQuote)
"Slight not what's near through aiming at what's far." - Euripides
"The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance; the wise grows it under his feet." - James Oppenheim
"If I have been able to see farther than others, it was because I stood on the shoulders of giants." - Isaac Newton
"One problem with gazing too frequently into the past is that we may turn around to find the future has run out on us." - Michael Cibenko
"To live is so startling it leaves time for little else." - Emily Dickinson
English philosopher Samuel Johnson said, "A man should keep his friendships in constant repair."
"Time, which changes people, does not alter the image we have retained of them." - Marcel Proust
"Time ripens all things. No man's born wise." - Cervantes
"Those who restrain desire do so because theirs is weak enough to be restrained." - William Blake
"Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life; define yourself." - H ...
"The brain is a wonderful organ. It starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office. ...
Alexander Dumas the Younger said, "Business? It's quite simple. It's other people's money."
"Never trust the advice of a man in difficulties." - Aesop
"If you wish your merit to be known, acknowledge that of other people." - Oriental Proverb
"The only whole heart is a broken one." - Rabbi Menachem Mendel
"He that climbs the tall tree has won right to the fruit." - Sir Walter Scott
"Change your thoughts and you change your world." - Norman Vincent Peale (via @nyc911)
"To love what you do and feel that it matters - how could anything be more fun?" - Katharine Graham
"No trumpets sound when the important decisions of our life are made. Destiny is made known silently." - Agnes DeMille
"We make a living by what we get, we make a life by what we give." - Winston Churchill
"You can't depend on your judgment when your imagination is out of focus." - Mark Twain
"The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes of mind." - William James
Stop anashneis
"As a man begins to live more seriously within, he begins to live more simply without." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"It takes a long time to bring excellence to maturity." - Publius Syrus
"What I need is someone who will make me do what I can." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"A smooth sea never made a skilled mariner. " - English Proverb
"A man with ability and the desire to accomplish something can do anything." - Donald Kircher
"Abilities wither under faultfinding, blossom under encouragement." - Donald A. Laird
"Executive ability is deciding quickly and getting somebody else to do the work." - John G. Pollard
"It is always pleasant to be urged to do something on the ground that one can do it well." - George Santayana
"Beware the fury of the patient man." - John Dryden
"Continuous effort, not strength or intelligence, is the key to unlocking our potential." - Winston Churchill
"Those who know nothing of foreign languages know nothing of their own." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"Self-esteem is the reputation we acquire with ourselves." - Nathaniel Branden
"He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves, and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper." - Edmund Burke
"Nothing can bring you peace but yourself." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"The aim of an argument or discussion should not be victory, but progress." - Joseph Joubert
Â "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." - Winston Churchill
"In the midst of winter, I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer." - Albert Camus
"I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies; for the hardest victory is over self." - Aristotle
"A book must be the ax for the frozen sea within us." - Franz Kafka
"Emancipation is the demand of civilization. That is a principle; everything else is an intrigue." - Ralph Waldo Emerson
"We cannot make good news out of bad practice." - Edward R. Murrow
"I desire ... to leave this one great fact clearly stated. There is no wealth but life." - John Ruskin
"There's no such thing as old age, there is only sorrow." - Edith Wharton
"We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit." - Aristotle
"It is the mind that makes the man, and our vigour is in our immortal soul." - Ovid
"The weaker the man in authority... the stronger his insistence that all his privileges be acknowledged." - Austin O'Malley
"The drying up a single tear has more of honest fame than shedding seas of gore." - Lord Byron
"Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save." - Will Rogers
"Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does." - Jean-Paul Sartre
"Water is the only drink for a wise man." - Henry David Thoreau
"When you can think of yesterday without regret and tomorrow without fear, you are near contentment." - Author Unknown
"Most powerful is he who has himself in his power." - Seneca
"We know accurately only when we know little; with knowledge doubt increases." - Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
"A wise man is he who does not grieve for the thing which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has." - Epictetus
"How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." - Henry David Thoreau
"So few people think. When we find one who really does, we call him a genius." - Author Unknown
"My words fly up, my thoughts remain below. Words without thoughts never to heaven go." - William Shakespeare
"Gold is worse poison to a man's soul, doing more murders in this loathsome world, than any mortal drug." - William Shakespeare
"It is the working man who is the happy man. It is the idle man who is the miserable man." - Benjamin Franklin
"How much time he saves who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks." - Marcus Aurelius
"Today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday." - Author Unknown
"Let us not be too particular; it is better to have old secondhand diamonds than none at all." - Mark Twain
"Do something every day that you don't want to do; this is the golden rule for acquiring the habit of doing your duty without pain." - M ...
